sentences.english: I've never worked for money before, not counting my chores at home.
sentences.chinese: 除了在家干点过点杂活，我还从来没有打工赚过钱呢。

sentences.english: Concentrate on their faces and it's like watching furry handymen changing a plug.
sentences.chinese: 看它们的脸就像是个干杂活的在换插头。

sentences.english: It was time to do the chores, and still he had not come.
sentences.chinese: 到了平时干杂活的时间，他依然没有回来。

sentences.english: ANGLE SHIFTS to reveal Red and Brooks doing filing chores.
sentences.chinese: 镜头转向瑞德和布鲁克斯在做些整理文档的杂活。

sentences.english: I spent the morning pottering about in the garden .
sentences.chinese: 我花了一个上午在花园里随便干了一些杂活。

sentences.english: The farmer's morning chores included cleaning the stables and milking the cows.
sentences.chinese: 农夫早上要干的杂活包括清扫马厩和给奶牛挤奶。

sentences.english: He is prepared to make a living by accepting any remunerative chore .
sentences.chinese: 为了生计，他准备接受任何有酬报的杂活。

sentences.english: I have so many chores to do today.
sentences.chinese: 我今天有太多的杂活要做。

sentences.english: As I walked toward the house I saw a lady doing chores in the front courtyard.
sentences.chinese: 我朝农宅走过去，看见一个女人正在前院干杂活。

sentences.english: He is prepared to make a living by accepting any remunerative chore.
sentences.chinese: 为了生计，他准备接受任何有酬报的杂活。

definition: to do odd jobs/to do unskilled work
odd jobs/servant or army orderly doing odd jobs
bitter work/hard toil/(loanword) coolie, unskilled Chinese laborer in colonial times
erhua variant of 重活[zhong4 huo2]
erhua variant of 幹活|干活[gan4 huo2]
